N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5908.3 - Applications

State Regulations
(a) Any application
for financial assistance shall be filed with the T&D program manager of the
foundation, and shall contain such information and data in addition to that
supplied in the current business plan, as may be requested by the T&D
program manager. (b) The application
shall contain a full disclosure of information regarding the principals of the
applicant's business, including relationships with foundation officers and
employees, if any. (c) The
application shall contain a full disclosure of all owners, officers, directors, partners or parties in interest of the business venture of the applicant, together with the total annual compensation of each, the percentage of
ownership of each and the personal guarantee or insurance maintained by each
for the benefit of the applicant, if any. (d) The application shall contain a statement
by the applicant of every payment made, or agreed to be made, by the applicant
to any person or entity in connection with the preparation, filing or
furtherance of the application. An applicant shall be required to submit proof
of all facts relating to any such payment or agreement, at or prior to the
closing of any agreement for financial assistance with the foundation and an
application shall contain a statement that the applicant has read, understands
and agrees to the provisions of this subdivision. (e) The application must be complete, and in
proper form. Notes
